title: Are people evil? If so, is there any way they can be good? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t think people are necessarily evil. There are definitely bad people out there, but our society is the creator of evil people. Have you ever met an evil baby? The answer is probably no. Something has to happen along the way to make these people turn bad. Of course, people can also be good; however, it is hard to answer whether or not people can turn good once again. I think that mostly something significant to them has to happen to make them turn good. Most times it’s too late, though… and most times… there is no way for them to turn good once again, because they don’t want to. People are not born evil.

People are evil. A PERSON can be good. People are mobs who tend to follow the loudest mouth. A PERSON can have a soul and feel for others. Watch Men In Black: A person is smart. People are dumb, panicky dangerous animals and you know it. Fifteen hundred years ago everybody knew the Earth was the center of the universe. Five hundred years ago, everybody knew the Earth was flat, and fifteen minutes ago, you knew that humans were alone on this planet. Just imagine what you'll know tomorrow.

That depends on your definition of good and evil. We’re certainly selfish. The cost to save a stranger’s life through the most efficient charities is estimated at around $1000 or so, but the vast majority of people don’t donate to much of their income to such charities (I certainly don’t). Each time we choose to keep $1000 rather than donate it, we necessarily imply that we value $1000 over the life of a stranger, so you could say we’re evil based on that. However, if you look at the prevalence of disease, war, violence and genocide over history, you’ll find that the general trend is downwards. The world is getting better (on average) as time goes on, so you could look at that and say humans are good.

People are not evil, their deeds are. It is their deeds which are good or bad; which can be different in different frames of reference. You need not worry about people being “evil” or “saintly”. It is their mindset you need to change to inspire them to do good. Change yourself to change the world, they say. :)  ✌️

All humans make mistakes. No, most people can be taught between right and wrong, with the exception of psychopaths. However, you must understand that people have different morals, which is why people tend to be on different sides on an argument.
